pullRequest.body:
Part of https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15524. This adds concrete calculations of the height and Krull Dimension for Nat, Int, WithTop, WithBot and ENat.

From the Carleson project.

---

* [x] depends on: #19251

  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> I think a bunch of these would be easier if you first proved that in a linear order one has height a = (Set.Iio a).ncard and coheight a = (Set.Ioi a).ncard

I assume you mean `Set.encard`?

Possibly, but at least my first attempt quickly ran into missing API around `Set.ncard`, e.g. to simplify a goal like
```
‚ä¢ (Set.Iio p.length).encard = p.length
```
(This is all in `Nat`). There is [Nat.card_fintypeIic](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Interval/Finset/Nat.html#Nat.card_fintypeIic), but nothing directly connecting `Fintype.card` and `Set.encard`.

I can leave it as a `proof_wanted` and a comment that it might simplify later proofs, but otherwise don‚Äôt hold this up?

Oh, but the `proof_wanted` is probably not worth the increase in imports.

Here is a sketch of the `LinearOrder` proof. The next step requires some lemma that for any set in a linear order there exists a function from the nats (or a finite prefix of cardinality of that set) into that set, to construct the `LTSeries` from. Or something like that. Anyways, bedtime, so just dumping this here for posterity.

```lean
theorem height_of_linearOrder {Œ± : Type*} [LinearOrder Œ±] (a : Œ±) :
    height a = (Set.Iio a).encard := by
  apply le_antisymm
  ¬∑ apply height_le
    intro p hlast
    calc ‚Üëp.length
      _ = (Set.Iio p.length).encard := by
        rw [‚Üê Set.Finite.cast_ncard_eq (by toFinite_tac)]
        rw [Set.ncard_eq_toFinset_card _]
        simp
      _ ‚â§ (Set.Iio a).encard := by
        apply Set.encard_le_encard_of_injOn (f := fun i : ‚Ñï ‚Ü¶ p i)
        case hf =>
          intro i hi
          simp at hi
          simp only [Set.mem_Iio, ‚Üêhlast]
          apply p.rel_of_lt
          simp [Fin.last]
          apply Fin.lt_def.mpr
          simp
          rw [Nat.mod_eq_of_lt (by omega)]
          exact hi
        case f_inj =>
          apply StrictMonoOn.injOn
          intro i hi j hj hij
          exact p.strictMono <| Fin.natCast_strictMono hj.le hij
  ¬∑ cases hc : (Set.Iio a).encard with
    | top =>
      simp only [top_le_iff]
      apply height_eq_top_iff.mpr
      intro n
      have p : LTSeries Œ± := sorry
      have hlen : p.length = n := sorry
      have hlast : p.last = a := sorry
      exact ‚ü®p, hlast, hlen‚ü©
    | coe n =>
      replace hc := congrArg ENat.toNat hc
      simp [‚Üê Set.ncard_def] at hc
      have p : LTSeries Œ± := sorry
      have hlen : p.length = n := sorry
      have hlast : p.last = a := sorry
      rw [‚Üê hlen, ‚Üê hlast]
      apply length_le_height_last
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11933455148/job/33260540038)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11933455148/job/33260539707)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Okay, looks complicated enough to be postponed.

maintainer merge
I think a bunch of these would be easier if you first proved that in a linear order one has `height a = (Set.Iio a).ncard` and `coheight a = (Set.Ioi a).ncard`

Okay, looks complicated enough to be postponed.

maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Should this equivalence be defined in the WithTop API?
Yes please! Same for `WithBot`
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19251
Can this be a general lemma about `NoMaxOrder`?
I'll give it a try. Should it then still be a simp lemma, or is that not good given the then rather unspecific lhs?

I gave it a try, it works. It seems I have to add
```
instance Int.instNoMinOrder : NoMinOrder ‚Ñ§ where
  exists_lt n := ‚ü®n - 1, n.pred_self_lt‚ü©
```
though ‚Äì where should I put them?

Are you sure this is missing? What does
```
import Mathlib

#synth NoMinOrder ‚Ñ§ 
```
say?

If it really is missing, it should go in `Order.Int`
Oh, my bad, I looked through the instances at https://loogle.lean-lang.org/?q=%7C-+NoMinOrder+_ but didn‚Äôt expect a level of indirection. But that's how mathlib works :-)
Same here
And this a general lemma about `NoMinOrder`

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma height_coe_withBot (x : Œ±) : height (x : WithBot Œ±) = height x + 1 := by
```
These are just specializations of the lemmas above, but maybe nice to give them for discoverability. Or is that not customary?
I think they are fine to have

```suggestion
```
Can you keep this alphabetical?

```suggestion
lemma krullDim_enat : krullDim ‚Ñï‚àû = ‚ä§ := by
```
same below
Can you camel case?

```suggestion
  left_inv _ := by simp
  right_inv _ := by simp
```
(Applied in #19251.)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(KrullDimension): concrete calculations

    intro p hlast
